tags: im dying for anything new here
summary: So I’ve been thinking about episode titles. And so far I think I’ve only got a few pegged down Imo. The Battle of Winterfell for...
body:
So I’ve been thinking about episode titles. And so far I think I’ve only got a few pegged down Imo. The Battle of Winterfell for episode three, The Dance of Dragon’s for the penultimate episode and then a Dream of Spring for the finale.

Anyone else have any idea of what the episode titles are going to be? Does anyone even care that much??

blog.name: the-acronomicon

I yell at tv shows so I won't scream at the world-
Disaster adult looking for a good time (eg. Terrible puns and obscure facts) - Not child friendly - Not American - Queer

tags: but honestly i don't think this is
body:
Musings on ‘Breaking the Wheel’

So, we don’t really know what it means for Daenerys to 'break the wheel’. With my spotty knowledge about Europe in medieval time I’m assuming it’s the wheel of fortune. It keeps spinning and putting different people on top.

As far as we’ve seen her she broke systems, but it’s still a throw of the dice who comes of that cleanly. All her experiments have failed. Freed slaves had to sell themselves back into slavery, the masters grabbed the power again and even if she 'won’ in Meereen no one else did. Their economic system is in ruins, with as a result famine and riots in the near future. The ones who already had the money, the power and the experience come out on top.

On the whole it’s easy to yell 'break the wheel’ if you’re the one on top of it, which Daenerys mostly has been. It has wobbled (Vaes Dothrak, Sons of the Harpy et al), but she has always maintained her position.

What she wants to do in Westeros is sit on the Iron Throne. Does this mean we’ll see major reform? Is there going to be a constitutional monarchy, with a (proto-) parliament? Somehow I don’t think so, because both in the books and in the show she has shown she sometimes has a hard time listening to council when it’s offered and she’s never had to share power. She’s doing her best to live up to the Targaryen legacy and she believes in Targaryen exceptionalism. The Targaryen legacy is an absolute monarchy. I don’t see her giving it up so soon.

So if she’s still an absolute monarch, did she truly break the wheel? She might break feudalism, but ending feudalism never ended petty squabbles or people lording power over other people. And she’d still sit at the top of the wheel of fortune, unaware she could fall off at any moment. Because it doesn’t exist anymore, right?

I’m really curious to see if Daenerys somehow manages to end her arc with actually breaking the wheel or if as per Jon’s words 'she’s more of the same’ without knowing she is.

26 days!

tags: can i tell yall the truth
summary: The writers and directors are not trying to trick you. The actors aren’t trying to throw you off. There is no mysterious,...
body:
Jon and Dany is End Game

The writers and directors are not trying to trick you. The actors aren’t trying to throw you off. There is no mysterious, labyrinthan political maneuvering on Jon’s part. There is no alternate romantic interests for Jon or Dany. This is Fire and Ice. This is End Game.

“…our characters have had PARALLEL journeys…” Emilia Clarke, Variety, March 2019

“the two came together to shoot Jon and Daenerys’ slow-burn Season 7 romance” Variety, March 2019

“He believes in Jon Snow like a lot of people do and has gotten to know him in their travels together last season,” Glen says. “He thinks he’s a GOOD MATCH with Daenerys best interests in mind. It’s a complicated emotion, but I think he feels that they would be a GOOD UNIFICATION and he’s basically supportive.” Iain Glen, EW, March 2019

“…Jon Snow and Daenerys Targaryen met and fell in love…” EW, March 2019

“He’s wondering how smart of a move [Jon and Dany getting romantically involved is], because PASSION and politics don’t mix well. He knows the two of them getting together could be very dangerous.” Peter Dinklage, EW, March 2019

“She TRULY LOVES Jon. Were she to find out about his title, it would cut deep.“ Emilia Clarke, TV Insider, January 2019

"Jon is someone who plays by the book. HE CANNOT TELL A LIE. Finding out about Dany would be very hard for him.” Kit Harington, TV Insider, January 2019

“Dany and Jon take it to the NEXT LEVEL. In one night. On one boat. Heading for Winterfell. Heading for Season 8.” Emilia Clarke, HBO Asia, February 2019

“And they’re going back as not so secret lovers.” Kit Harington, HBO Asia, February 2019


“I think it’s an INEVITABILITY from about halfway through the season that Jon and Daenerys are gonna fall into bed together.” Kit Harington, HBO BTS Commentary, August 2017

“I think they both know it’s wrong. I think they both know it’s going to cause problems. But it’s that thing, when you suddenly feel that deeply about someone and you go through those events together, it’s like a runaway train. YOU CAN’T STOP IT FROM HAPPENING.” Kit Harington, HBO BTS Commentary 2017

“it described the fact that they were LOVEMAKING, but it didn’t go into great detail in terms of what was going on between them in that moment. We built in a moment between Kit [Harington] and Emilia [Clarke] where they stopped and looked into each other’s eyes. The intention from my point of view, and their point of view, too, is that THEY’RE DRIVEN BY PASSION into this. They don’t even fully understand what it’s all about and what the consequences of it are.” Jeremy Podeswa, The Hollywood Reporter, August 2018

“Knowing that Jon Snow and Daenerys would eventually fall in love just as the series revealed Jon’s true parentage, Djawadi tried to hint at his final theme, “Truth,” that would play during the pivotal finale scene.” EW, August 2017


“The trick with this theme is that it really had to be a LOVE THEME but when we played it in earlier episodes, you don’t want to give away the love too soon.” Ramon Djawadi, EE, August 2017

“…[I]n terms of going North to rescue them, a number of people there have different CLAIMS ON HER HEART…and then of course, there’s Jon Snow. You definitely get the sense that he’s become quite IMPORTANT to her in a short amount of time.” David Benioff, HBO Inside the Episode 7.06, August 2017

“I think that when she sees him return…that’s a big moment for her in terms of the way she FEELS FOR HIM.” D.B. Weiss, HBO Inside the Episode 7.06, August 2017

“I don’t think either one of them really knew exactly how powerful their feelings were towards each other in these moments. Just the notion of falling in love with someone involves weakness…but she feels that happening and he feels that happening for her. I think both of them are on unequal ground and especially because it’s with an equal.” David Benioff, HBO Inside the Episode 7.06, August 2017

“And to make it all ever more complicated, they’re starting to get ATTRACTED TO EACH OTHER…” David Benioff, HBO Inside the Episode 7.04, August 2017

“Jon looks to the people whose opinions he VALUES MOST: Davos. DANY.” Game of Thrones Script Ep 707, The Dragon and the Wolf

“Jon doesn’t quite smile because smiling would seem inappropriate. But still, that almost LOOKS LIKE A SMILE.” Game of Thrones Script Ep 707, The Dragon and the Wolf

“It is the most important relationship that either of them has. I think it is a really, really defining thing for them both.” Emilia Clarke, The New Paper, March 2019

“The King in the North found UNEXPECTED LOVE in Daenerys’ arms…” EW, March 2019

“The end of the world might be coming soon but at least he’s in love with somebody and knows who he is…” Kit Harington, EW, March 2019

blog.name: instantbouquetface-me
blog.title: Look! It's a bird! It's a plane!...It's a speck on my glasses...

summary: Daenerys' attitude towards Viserys has always bothered me. Sure he was foolish. He had a few screws loose. Even then, couldn't...
question: Daenerys' attitude towards Viserys has always bothered me. Sure he was foolish. He had a few screws loose. Even then, couldn't she have just told Drogo that he was a crazy person and just lock him up? The Dothraki must know what crazy people are too. However she said nothing. She gave Drogo her okay even when he was looking at her questioningly. That looks bad.
answer:
Hi Anon,

You’re definitely not the first one to feel this way. I suspect that perhaps they weren’t very clear in their portrayal of things in the show. Even then, there is quite enough if you watch Dany’s arc carefully. The whole problem with Viserys was given a fairly detailed treatment by @mhysaofdragons last year in the second part of her answer to THIS ASK HERE.

I have little to add to that. I’ll just say in addition that there are two different things here.

Firstly, the show and book portrayal are different. In the books it is quite clear that there is no real choice for Dany. Viserys threatens the pregnant Khaleesi in front of the Khalasar and Drogo, in their holy place where he is not supposed to draw a blade. Dany even tries to stop him by letting him take her eggs but that doesn’t stop him. There is no way Drogo can allow this to go unpunished. It would make him look too weak. Viserys’ life was forfeit. In the show this was not emphasized as clearly and it seemed like Dany might have had more of say in it. But not really if you consider all these factors. 

Secondly, is an issue related to Dany’s own development. The thing is that Dany has hardly ever received any love in her life. She keeps thinking that feelings that shouldn’t otherwise qualify as love are love. I think it took her time (even in the show) to realize that Viserys really did not love her at all. Not even one little bit. Had no concern for her whatsoever as his sister. Really saw her as nothing more than a piece of property. Completely dehumanized. Sold into slavery.

I mean compare with Littlefinger who married Sansa to Ramsey for political reasons. Littlefinger actually did not know what Ramsey was like. He didn’t think he was handing Sansa over to a terrible fate. And he did try to make up for it. Compare that to what Viserys said to Dany at the very beginning, i.e. that he would gladly let all the Dothraki horde and even their horses rape her if it meant Viserys getting an army.

I don’t think it had fully sunk in for Dany that Viserys saw her as nothing more than property. Even in the initial episodes of season 1, even after being raped she does not fully understand this. And here’s the kicker. The thing is that Viserys wasn’t even fully mad at this juncture. He may have been going in that direction, but he still had much of his faculties about him. But he still treated her like this. He wasn’t just an abusive brother who still cared for her in some way. He didn’t care for her at all. Emilia has said in an interview that when he threatens her and her baby, all the affection she has left for him goes away too. And yet we see later that she still names a dragon after him. She never had anyone else. She says he was good to her once. And yet the descriptions we sometimes hear of her childhood don’t seem to present him as loving either (e.g. twisting her hair for saying she wanted to be a sailor). But what else did she have?

Almost every expression of ‘love’ that she has seen so far is screwed up in some way. Every single one. Jorah sees his wife in her and seems to want to isolate her from anyone and anything else, make her dependent on just him, like Littlefinger with Sansa. Daario is more interested in her as a conquest. Drogo was basically a master. Viserys’ ‘love’ for her may be no more than Dany’s own projection and imagination. Her followers have an impersonal sort of love for her for freeing them etc. Maybe Missandei can be counted here. But with Jon she’ll find the love she deserves.

29. INFP.

tags: ps this has nothing to do with jon
it's about what daenerys has fought for her whole life
and the people who want her to be nothing more than the means to an end
an end that she's apparently not included in
summary: So Daenerys is going to have done all this hard work for Westeros to survive. She is the one who gathered the largest army in...
body:
So Daenerys is going to have done all this hard work for Westeros to survive. She is the one who gathered the largest army in the world. She’s the one who brought dragons back to life. She’s the one who made it possible for the living to survive and defeat the dead. Daenerys did that and then what, she’s going to sacrifice herself to save the world too? She’s going to not only give her armies and her dragons but her life as well? She’s going to have done all this work only to die so that we can watch a man get the credit? The throne?

How is that any different than all the celebrated men throughout history who were only capable of doing what they did because of the work of women whose efforts went unacknowledged? This is literally all of human history. Women do the work. Men get the credit.

And so many people in this fandom want this to be the unchallenged rule. They want this story to end the very same way. Antis want Daenerys to die as a villain and fans want her to die to ‘complete her arc’ and I am just tired. Why does death have to be the only satisfactory ending to her journey?

body:
Thoughts on Jonerys

I’m still not sure wether or not I ship Jonerys I feel like I have valid reasons not too but reasons to ship them. Idk if it’s just me but the relationship seems so forced to me that it’s hard to be believable considering she told him to bend the knee every 5 minutes. Hell I even lost a lot of love for Dany throughout the seasons because sometimes she was so entitled. It’s just that they act like Dany and Jon has these monumental in-depth moments when they didn’t.

IHEARTGOT is dedicated to the HBO television series Game of Thrones, which is based on the A Song of Ice and Fire novels written by George R. R. Martin, and its cast. We update daily to bring you the latest pictures, edits, gifs and more of the show and the books. 
This is NOT a spoiler-free blog.
We track #iheartgot.

summary:
When Dany reborn from the fire she had a Rhaegal like baby near her belly.  His name comes from Jon Snow’s Father 
When Viserys...
body:
When Dany reborn from the fire she had a Rhaegal like baby near her belly. His name comes from Jon Snow’s Father

When Viserys hurts her in book Dany took Rhaegal’s egg near her belly and cried .

When Dany found out about her pregnancy was season 1 Episode 3. This episodes name was “Lord Snow “. Her babies name Rhaego. Name comes from Rhaegar. Father of Jon Snow.

When Iliryo gifted her eggs Dany took Rhaegal’s egg in her hand.

summary: Wtf is anon talking about? People don’t hate Dany because of Emilia, they hate on her for so many stupid reasons. Dany was loved...
question: Wtf is anon talking about? People don’t hate Dany because of Emilia, they hate on her for so many stupid reasons. Dany was loved in season 1 to 3/4, then she got to Meereen where the writing started to suck, around this same time, Dany started putting her power into action. So no, it’s not because of Emilia, it’s a mixture of writing and misogyny.
answer:
Hey anon,

I think this is very true. Note how those who hate her liked her when she was weak and powerless, however, the moment she became strong than she became entitled and arrogant. And of course, the writers think that strong women don’t show emotion so Daenerys hasn’t been allowed to show much emotion after season 1.

TTFN

blog.title: The Path to Oadara
blog.description: To go forward, I must go back and make some delicious lemon cakes.

summary: Those people who thinks Dany is hated just because of the show has never been in the ASOIAF fandom before the show even started...
question: Those people who thinks Dany is hated just because of the show has never been in the ASOIAF fandom before the show even started right? Because i can assure you that a lot of these forums had topics about her becoming mad, or her turning dark, or being Nissa Nissa or whatever. Dany isn't hated because of the show, or the way Emilia portrays her, she's hated because of mysoginist assholes that can't accept a woman being in a position of power.
answer:
Word! and, word!

Ive been part of the book forums and there just as hateful there as with the show. Daeneyrs being an assertive women with power is threatening to many, it’s against the social standards of the patriarchy that they are use to. So they hate.

TTFN
